titles.title: Day Is Dying In The West

authors.author: Mary A. Lathbury William F. Sherwin

verse.name: c1
verse.lines: Holy, holy, holy Lord, God of hosts newline Heav'n and earth are full of Thee; newline Heav'n and earth are praising Thee, newline O Lord, Most High.

verse.name: v1
verse.lines: Day is dying in the west newline Heav'n is touching earth with rest; newline Wait and worship while the night newline Sets her ev'ning lamps alight, newline Thro' all the sky.

verse.name: v2
verse.lines: Lord of life, beneath the dome, newline Of the universe Thy home; newline Gather us who seek Thy face, newline To the fold of Thy embrace newline For Thou art nigh.

verse.name: v3
verse.lines: While the deep'ning shadows fall newline Heart of love enfolding all, newline Thro' the glory and the grace newline Of the stars that veil Thy face; newline Our hearts ascend.

verse.name: v4
verse.lines: When forever from our sight, newline Pass the stars the day; newline The night Lord of angels, newline On our eyes let eternal morning rise, newline And shadows end.
